member.name: T:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice
member.summary:
Reader device
The reader device is an \ref AccessibleDevices "accessible device" representing exactly one reader module on a sias instrument.
member.details:
\ingroup Dev_Reader
The interface includes - configuration properties for the read filters \n Take care to have the right configuration there, as this is not necessary corresponding to the hardware. - a layout property for the readers slot - methods for start reading as well as requesting the read data from module. .
%SReaderDevice class diagram
\image html "SReaderDevice.png"

member.name: F:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice._Slot
member.summary: ISlot array for the slots of the Reader

member.name: M:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice.GetErrorInfos
member.summary: This interface function returns the default error messages which can be generated by this device.

member.name: M:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice.HandleModuleError(System.Boolean,System.Object[])
member.summary: This method handles the module errors of SReader devices
member.details: Possible Module types: - 0x0048 (\ref Sias::CanDev::eMODULE_TYPE_CONST "MT_Reader") - 0x0049 (\ref Sias::CanDev::eMODULE_TYPE_CONST "MT_ICB_Reader") . Handled errors: - none .
member.param: true to force the handler to handle the error

member.name: F:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice.NoOfReadRequests
member.summary: Number of Read requests (number of filters for actual/last reading)

member.name: F:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice.NoOfDataRecords
member.summary: Number of data records in memory buffer

member.name: F:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice.RecSize
member.summary: Data Record size (Number of data values (words) in one record

member.name: F:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice.ReadBuffer
member.summary: Memory buffer for storing the reader data

member.name: M:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice.FilterIndex(System.Int32)
member.summary: This function calculates the filter index from a given filter value. The filter value could either be a wave length [nm] or a filter index.

member.name: M:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice.ReadDataAvail(System.Int32)
member.summary: This method checks if we have data at the defined data index. If the reader is active it will wait until it is finished before the method returns. If the data is not already transferred from the readers module memory, the method will transfer the data to a local buffer.
member.param: Data index (0..2) depends on the used number of read filters
member.returns: true if data available or false if not

member.name: M:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice.GetReadValue(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method gets a data value from reader data. To check if the data index is valid it will call the ReadDataAvail method.
member.param: Data index (0..2) depends on the used number of read filters
Value index (0..95) typically this indicates the cavity of the MTP

member.name: M:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice.StartRead(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Start reader command.
This command starts the reader for measuring with three different filters. Take care some modules may not support three filter reading.

member.name: M:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice.StartRead(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Start reader command. This command starts the reader for measuring with two different filters.

member.name: M:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice.StartRead(System.Int32)
member.summary: Start reader command. This command starts the reader for measuring with one filters.

member.name: M:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice.IsSlotAccessible
member.summary: Check if the reader slot is accessible (the drawer is open) or not
member.returns: True if the reader slot is accessible, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice.AllowAccess(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allow/deny accessing the reader device slot
member.param: True to allow access, false to deny

member.name: F:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice.ActualLayoutDevice
member.summary: Actual layout device. E.g. for sending the display state to layout

member.name: M:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice.AttachLayoutData(Sias.Core.Interfaces.ILayoutDevice)
member.summary:
Attach layout data.
This method tries to attach the layout data found at the given layout device to the device. If this will succeed it returns true. If it fails it returns false. In this case the calling method should retry until it finds a fitting layout device.
member.param: The layout device to attach or null to unattach an attached layout device.
member.returns: true if attachable, false if not

member.name: M:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice.GetAccessMode(System.Object)
member.summary: Get Access mode. This Method is used to request the actual access mode.
member.returns: Access mode for the given caller object

member.name: M:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice.SetAccessMode(System.Object,Sias.Core.Interfaces.SAccessMode,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set access mode. This method prepares the reader module to allow the requested access.
member.remarks: Remarks: - If the timeout is longer than the remaining reader time the function will not wait for the finished timeout. It will return inaccessible immediately - There is not way to stop the reader yet, so \nlink{Sias::Core::Interfaces,SAccessMode.RequestInterruption} will of course not stop the reader .

member.name: P:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice.Slot
member.summary: ISlot array for the slots of the Reader

member.name: T:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice.ErrorCodes
member.summary: This static class keeps the error code constants of the \ref Sias::Reader::SReaderDevice errors.

member.name: F:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice.ErrorCodes.TimeoutError
member.summary: 0x001350: Reader timeout error, either no answer from reader or active for more then 300 s

member.name: F:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice.ErrorCodes.ValuesTooLow
member.summary: 0x061352: AD converter count or Values too low

member.name: F:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice.ErrorCodes.NoDataAvail
member.summary: 0x001353: No data available when trying to request reader data from the reader

member.name: F:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice.ErrorCodes.IncorrectCalibrateFilter
member.summary: 0x001354: Incorrect filter index value at calibrate command

member.name: F:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice.ErrorCodes.FilterReferenceError1
member.summary: 0xA41352: filter could not be referenced after measurement

member.name: F:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice.ErrorCodes.FilterReferenceError2
member.summary: 0xA51352: filter referencing after measurement is wrong

member.name: F:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice.ErrorCodes.XSensorError
member.summary: 0x111352: Invalid sensor state of motor X

member.name: F:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice.ErrorCodes.YSensorError
member.summary: 0x211352: Invalid sensor state of motor Y

member.name: F:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice.ErrorCodes.FSensorError
member.summary: 0x311352: Invalid sensor state of filter motor

member.name: F:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice.ErrorCodes.XHomeSensorTooSoon
member.summary: 0x441352: transport x: Home sensor reached too soon

member.name: F:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice.ErrorCodes.XHomeSensorTooLate
member.summary: 0x451352: transport x: Home sensor reached too late

member.name: F:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice.ErrorCodes.YHomeSensorTooSoon
member.summary: 0x541352: transport y: Home sensor reached too soon

member.name: F:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice.ErrorCodes.YHomeSensorTooLate
member.summary: 0x551352: transport y: Home sensor reached too late

member.name: F:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice.ErrorCodes.IncorrectFilterValue
member.summary: 0x001800: Incorrect filter value (wavelength), the filter is not in expected range

member.name: F:Sias.Reader.SReaderDevice.ErrorCodes.FilterNotFound
member.summary: 0x001801: A filter with the defined wavelength is not configured
